info.description: Complete Terraform Module and Provider Registry with SCM integration, mirrors, and storage backends
info.title: Terraform Registry API

get.description: Implements the Terraform service discovery protocol. Returns the base URLs for the Module Registry and Provider Registry endpoints.
List mirror approval requests, optionally filtered by organization or status. Requires admin scope.

post.description: Create a new mirror provider approval request. Requires admin scope.

400.description: Invalid request or mirror config ID

get.description: Returns a specific mirror approval request by ID. Requires admin scope.

put.description: Approve or reject a mirror provider approval request. Requires admin scope.

get.description: List all provider mirror configurations, optionally filtered to enabled only. Requires admin scope.

post.description: Create a new provider mirror configuration. Requires admin scope.

409.description: Mirror with this name already exists

get.description: Retrieve a specific mirror configuration by ID. Requires admin scope.

put.description: Update a provider mirror configuration. All fields are optional. Requires admin scope.

400.description: Invalid request, ID, or registry URL

delete.description: Delete a provider mirror configuration and its sync history. Requires admin scope.

get.description: Get the current sync status, active sync, and recent sync history for a mirror. Requires admin scope.

post.description: Trigger an immediate sync for a mirror configuration. Returns 409 if a sync is already in progress. Requires admin scope.
Create a module record without a version file. Used by the SCM publishing flow. Requires modules:publish scope.

get.description: Retrieve the SCM repository link configuration and webhook details for a module.

200.description: Repository link details including webhook URL and status

404.description: Module is not linked to a repository

put.description: Update the configuration of an existing SCM repository link for a module.

400.description: Invalid module ID or request body

404.description: Module is not linked to a repository

post.description:
Link a module to a source repository in an SCM provider. Generates a unique webhook callback URL
(containing an embedded URL secret) that must be registered in the repository's webhook settings.
The module must not already be linked. Validates that both the module and the SCM provider exist.

400.description: Invalid module or provider ID, or malformed request body

404.description: Module not found or SCM provider not found

409.description: Module is already linked to a repository

delete.description:
Remove the SCM repository link from a module, disabling all webhook-based and manual syncing.
If the link has a registered webhook ID, a best-effort request is made to delete the webhook from
the SCM provider using the calling user's OAuth token. Webhook removal failure is non-fatal â€” the
database link record is always deleted regardless of whether the remote call succeeds.

404.description: Module is not linked to a repository

get.description: Retrieve the recent webhook event log for a module's SCM repository link (last 50 events).

404.description: Module is not linked to a repository

post.description:
Manually trigger an asynchronous repository scan that imports matching tag-based versions from the
linked SCM repository. The endpoint returns 202 immediately; the sync runs in the background.
Tags are matched against the configured pattern (default: v*) and the semantic version is extracted.
Versions that already exist in the registry are silently skipped. The caller's OAuth token is used
for SCM API access and is proactively refreshed if it is expired or within 5 minutes of expiry.

401.description: Unauthorized or no OAuth token for this SCM provider

404.description: Module is not linked to a repository

500.description: Internal server error (connector build, token decryption, etc.)

get.description: List mirror access policies, optionally filtered by organization. Requires admin scope.

post.description: Create a new mirror access policy (allow or deny). Requires admin scope.
Evaluate all mirror policies for a specific provider to determine if access is allowed or denied. Requires admin scope.

get.description: Returns a specific mirror access policy by ID. Requires admin scope.

put.description: Update an existing mirror access policy. Requires admin scope.

400.description: Invalid request, ID, or policy type

delete.description: Delete a mirror access policy. Requires admin scope.

get.description: Returns all available RBAC role templates. Requires admin scope.

post.description: Create a new custom RBAC role template with specified scopes. Requires admin scope.

409.description: Role template with this name already exists

get.description: Returns a specific role template by ID. Requires admin scope.

put.description: Update an existing custom role template. Cannot modify system role templates. Requires admin scope.

delete.description: Delete a custom role template. Cannot delete system role templates. Requires admin scope.

get.description: Returns aggregated statistics for the admin dashboard including module, provider, user, organization, download, and SCM provider counts.
Returns all Terraform binary mirror configurations. Requires mirrors:read scope.

post.description: Creates a new named Terraform binary mirror configuration. Requires mirrors:manage scope.

409.description: Config with this name already exists

get.description: Returns a specific Terraform binary mirror configuration. Requires mirrors:read scope.

put.description: Updates a Terraform binary mirror configuration. Requires mirrors:manage scope.

delete.description: Deletes a Terraform binary mirror config and all its associated versions/history. Requires mirrors:manage scope.

get.description: Returns the most recent sync run records for the specified config. Requires mirrors:read scope.

parameters.description: Maximum number of history rows to return (default: 50)
parameters.name: limit

get.description: Returns the status and summary stats for a specific mirror config. Requires mirrors:read scope.

post.description: Enqueues a manual sync for the specified mirror config. Requires mirrors:manage scope.

get.description: Returns all Terraform versions known to the specified mirror config. Requires mirrors:read scope.
Returns metadata and per-platform sync status for a single version. Requires mirrors:read scope.
get.summary: Get a specific mirrored Terraform version

delete.description: Removes a version and its platform records. Stored binaries are not deleted from storage. Requires mirrors:manage scope.

get.description: Returns per-platform sync details for a specific version. Requires mirrors:read scope.
get.summary: List platforms for a Terraform version

get.description: List API keys with optional filtering by organization. Users with api_keys:manage scope can view all keys in an organization, otherwise only their own keys are visible.

post.description: Create a new API key with specified scopes. The full API key is only returned once during creation.

201.description: API key created successfully (full key returned once)

403.description: Forbidden - no role or scopes exceed permissions

get.description: Retrieve a specific API key by ID. Users can only access their own keys unless they have admin scope.

403.description: Forbidden - access denied to this key

put.description: Update an API key's name, scopes, or expiration. Users can only update their own keys unless they have admin scope.

parameters.description: Update request with optional name, scopes, and expires_at fields
parameters.name: body

403.description: Forbidden - access denied or scopes exceed permissions

delete.description: Delete a specific API key by ID. Users can only delete their own keys unless they have admin scope.

403.description: Forbidden - access denied to this key

post.description: Rotate an API key by creating a new key and optionally scheduling the old key's expiration. Users can only rotate their own keys unless they have admin scope.

parameters.description: Rotation request with optional grace period (0-72 hours)
parameters.name: body

200.description: New API key and old key status

403.description: Forbidden - access denied to this key

get.description: Handles the callback from OAuth provider after user authorizes. Internal endpoint - automatically redirected to by OAuth provider.

301.description: Redirects to frontend with auth token in URL

401.description: Failed to exchange code for token

get.description: Redirect user to OAuth provider (OIDC or Azure AD) to begin authentication flow

parameters.description: OAuth provider: oidc or azuread (default: oidc)
parameters.name: provider

302.description: Redirects to OAuth provider authorization URL

400.description: Invalid provider or provider not configured

500.description: Failed to generate state or internal error

get.description: Retrieve information about the currently authenticated user, including organization memberships and role templates

200.description: Current user information with memberships and role templates

post.description: Exchange existing JWT token for a fresh one with extended expiration

200.description: New JWT token with extended expiration

post.description: Upload a new module version as a .tar.gz archive. Creates the module if it doesn't exist. Requires modules:publish scope.

201.description: id, namespace, name, system, version, checksum, size_bytes

400.description: Invalid request, bad version format, or invalid archive

get.description: Search for modules by name, namespace, or provider system with pagination.
Retrieve a module with all its versions, download counts, and metadata. Requires modules:read scope.

200.description: id, namespace, name, system, versions, download_count, ...

delete.description: Delete a module and all its versions, including files in storage. Requires modules:delete scope.
Delete a specific version of a module, including its file in storage. Requires modules:delete scope.

post.description: Mark a specific module version as deprecated with an optional message. Requires modules:publish scope.

delete.description: Remove the deprecated status from a module version. Requires modules:publish scope.

get.description: Get a paginated list of all organizations.

post.description: Create a new organization in the registry.

409.description: Organization with this name already exists

get.description: Search organizations by name or display name with pagination.
Retrieve a specific organization by its ID, including member list.

put.description: Update an existing organization's display name.

delete.description: Remove an organization and its associated records.

get.description: Retrieve all members of a specific organization including user details.

post.description: Add a user as a member to an organization, optionally assigning a role template.

put.description: Update a member's role template within an organization.

delete.description: Remove a user from an organization's membership.

post.description: Upload a provider binary (.zip) for a specific platform. Creates provider and version if they don't exist. Requires providers:publish scope.

parameters.description: ASCII-armored GPG public key for signing verification
parameters.name: gpg_public_key

201.description: id, namespace, type, version, os, arch, checksum, size_bytes

400.description: Invalid request, version format, platform, or binary

409.description: Platform already exists for this version

get.description: Search for providers by name or namespace with pagination.
Retrieve a provider with all its versions and platforms. Requires providers:read scope.

delete.description: Delete a provider and all its versions and platform binaries from storage. Requires providers:delete scope.
Delete a specific provider version and all its platform binaries from storage. Requires providers:delete scope.

post.description: Mark a specific provider version as deprecated with an optional message. Requires providers:publish scope.

delete.description: Remove the deprecated status from a provider version. Requires providers:publish scope.

get.description: List all SCM provider configurations, optionally filtered by organization. Requires admin scope.

post.description: Create a new SCM provider configuration (GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, etc.). Requires admin scope.

get.description: Retrieve a specific SCM provider configuration by ID. Requires admin scope.

put.description: Update an existing SCM provider configuration. All fields are optional. Requires admin scope.

delete.description: Delete an SCM provider configuration. Requires admin scope.

get.description: Start the OAuth authorization flow for an SCM provider. Returns the authorization URL to redirect the user to. For PAT-based providers, returns guidance on using POST /token instead.
Processes the OAuth callback from the SCM provider, exchanges the code for tokens, stores them, and redirects to the frontend success page.

400.description: Invalid provider ID, code, or state

post.description: Manually trigger a refresh of the current user's OAuth token for an SCM provider using the stored refresh token.

get.description: Returns whether the current user is connected to an SCM provider and token metadata (without exposing the token itself).

200.description: connected: bool, connected_at: time, expires_at: time, token_type: string

delete.description: Revoke and delete the current user's OAuth or PAT token for an SCM provider.

get.description: List repositories available to the current user from an SCM provider. Optionally search by name.

parameters.description: Search query to filter repositories by name
parameters.name: search

401.description: Unauthorized or not connected to provider

get.description: List branches for a specific repository from an SCM provider. Used during module linking to select the default branch.

400.description: Invalid provider ID or missing parameters

401.description: Unauthorized or not connected to provider

get.description: List tags (version tags) for a specific repository from an SCM provider. Used during module linking to select which tags to publish.

400.description: Invalid provider ID or missing parameters

401.description: Unauthorized or not connected to provider

post.description: Store a Personal Access Token for a PAT-based SCM provider (e.g. Bitbucket Data Center).

200.description: message: Personal Access Token saved successfully

400.description: Invalid provider ID, request, or not a PAT provider

post.description: Creates the initial admin user record and adds them to the default organization with admin role. The email must match the OIDC identity that will be used for the first login.

200.description: message: string, email: string, organization: string, role: string

post.description: Finalizes the initial setup. Verifies that OIDC, storage, and admin user are configured, then permanently disables setup endpoints by clearing the setup token.

400.description: Setup is incomplete â€” missing required configuration

post.description: Saves OIDC provider configuration to the database (encrypted) and activates it for runtime use.
Tests an OIDC provider configuration by performing discovery and verifying the issuer endpoint responds. Does NOT save anything.

200.description: success: bool, message: string, issuer: string

get.description: Returns the full setup status including OIDC, storage, and admin configuration state. No authentication required.

post.description: Saves storage backend configuration to the database and marks storage as configured.
Tests a storage backend configuration without saving. Performs a live connectivity probe.
Validates the provided setup token. Returns 200 if valid. Used by the frontend wizard to verify the token before proceeding.

get.description: Returns the currently active storage configuration (credentials redacted). Requires admin scope.
Returns all storage configurations (credentials redacted). Requires admin scope.

post.description: Create a new storage configuration. Supported backends: local, azure, s3, gcs. Requires admin scope.

Validates a storage configuration and performs a live connectivity probe against the target backend
without saving anything to the database. The backend is instantiated from the provided input, then
an Exists probe (10-second timeout) is executed to confirm reachability and correct credentials.
Supported backends: local, azure, s3, gcs. Requires admin scope.

200.description: success: bool, message: string â€” true when the backend is reachable

get.description: Returns a specific storage configuration by ID (credentials redacted). Requires admin scope.

put.description: Update a storage configuration. Cannot change backend_type of the active configuration. Requires admin scope.

delete.description: Delete a storage configuration. Cannot delete the active configuration. Requires admin scope.

400.description: Invalid ID or cannot delete active config

post.description: Set a storage configuration as the active one. All other configurations will be deactivated. Requires admin scope.

get.description: Get a paginated list of all users with their organization role templates. Requires users:read scope.

post.description: Create a new user. Typically users are created via OIDC; this endpoint is for admin use. Requires users:write scope.

409.description: User with this email already exists

get.description: Get the organization memberships for the currently authenticated user. No special scopes required.
Search users by email or name. Requires users:read scope.
Get a user by ID with their organization memberships. Requires users:read scope.

put.description: Update a user's name or email. Requires users:write scope.

409.description: Email already in use by another user

delete.description: Delete a user by ID. Cascading deletes will handle related records. Requires users:write scope.

get.description: Get the organization memberships for a specific user. Requires users:read scope.
Returns the health status of the service, including database connectivity.

503.description: status: unhealthy, error: database connection failed

get.description: Returns whether the service is ready to accept traffic. Checks database connectivity.

503.description: ready: false, error: database not ready

get.description: Returns all Terraform/OpenTofu versions that have been fully or partially synced by the named binary mirror.

404.description: Mirror not found or not enabled

get.description: Returns the latest stable Terraform/OpenTofu version available in the named binary mirror.

404.description: Mirror not found or no latest version

get.description: Returns metadata and platform list for a specific version in the named binary mirror.
Returns a signed download URL for the requested Terraform binary. The URL is valid for 15 minutes. Increments the terraform_binary_downloads_total Prometheus counter.

404.description: Mirror, version, or platform not found

get.description: Returns all available versions for a provider in the Terraform Network Mirror Protocol format.
Returns download URLs and hashes for all platforms of a specific provider version, per the Terraform Network Mirror Protocol.
List all available versions for a specific module. Implements the Terraform Module Registry Protocol.
Returns a 204 response with an X-Terraform-Get header containing the download URL. Implements the Terraform Module Registry Protocol.

204.description: No Content â€” X-Terraform-Get header contains the download URL

get.description: List all available versions and platforms for a specific provider. Implements the Terraform Provider Registry Protocol.
Returns download URL, checksums, and signing key info for a specific provider platform. Implements the Terraform Provider Registry Protocol.

404.description: Provider, version, or platform not found

get.description: Returns the current API version and supported protocol versions.

post.description:
Receives and processes incoming webhook events from SCM providers (GitHub, GitLab, Azure DevOps, Bitbucket).
Two-layer security is applied: the URL-embedded secret (last path segment of the registered callback URL)
is verified first with a constant-time comparison, and then the provider's HMAC payload signature is
validated against the stored webhook secret. Both checks must pass before the payload is processed.
Accepted events are logged. Tag-push events trigger asynchronous auto-publish when AutoPublish is enabled.

parameters.description: Module source repository link ID (UUID) â€” uniquely identifies the SCM-to-module mapping
parameters.name: module_source_repo_id

parameters.description: URL-embedded webhook secret generated at link time; used as a first-line constant-time guard before HMAC validation
parameters.name: secret

200.description: message: webhook received, log_id: UUID of the audit log entry

400.description: Invalid repository ID or malformed/unreadable payload

401.description: URL secret mismatch or HMAC payload signature invalid

404.description: Repository link or SCM provider not found

500.description: Internal server error (connector build, log write, etc.)

grace_period_hours.description: GracePeriodHours is how long the old key should remain valid (0 = immediate revocation)

role_template_id.description: UUID of role template, or null to clear

provider_filter.description: List of provider names to mirror

upstream_registry.description: What this policy applies to (supports wildcards)

created_by.description: User ID who created this module

created_by_name.description: Joined fields (not stored in modules table)

client_secret.description: Plain text input, encrypted before storage

azure_account_key.description: Plain text input, encrypted before storage

platforms.description: Populated by joins â€” not stored in columns

Bearer.description: "JWT token or API key. For JWT: 'Bearer {token}'. For API Key: 'Bearer {api_key}'"
Bearer.name: Authorization
